steps.title: Visit a local post office and obtain a Certified Mail Form 3800.
steps.content: Visit a local post office and obtain a Certified Mail Form 3800. [2] X Research source This form contains a green and white sticker that includes a barcode, which will allow you to track your mail through the USPS. [3] X Research source The form also contains a perforated receipt, which serves as proof that you mailed the item. Write all of the required information on the form, including the recipient’s name and address.

steps.title: Remove the backing and place the sticker along the top edge of the envelope you are mailing, directly to the right of the return address area.
steps.content: Remove the backing and place the sticker along the top edge of the envelope you are mailing, directly to the right of the return address area. Make sure to leave room on the top right portion of the envelope to apply correct postage . On a package, the sticker can be placed to the left of the address area.

steps.title: Pay the appropriate postage for the specified type of mail delivery.
steps.content: Pay the appropriate postage for the specified type of mail delivery. Then pay for additional services, including a fee for USPS Certified Mail ($4.35USD as of 8/8/2023 and Return receipt (PS Form 3811) cost either $3.35 for a regular mailed receipt or 2.10 for an emailed receipt). [4] X Research source Both first-class and priority mail can be sent via certified mail. First-class mail includes envelopes and packages that weigh 13 ounces or less. Priority mail service offers delivery in a timely and expedited fashion, generally within two to three days.

steps.title: Decide if you want to purchase restricted delivery service.
steps.content: Decide if you want to purchase restricted delivery service. [5] X Research source Restricted delivery service guarantees that a specified person receives and signs for the certified mail. [6] X Research source If you select this option, you need to endorse, or initial, the column on the certified mail form that is marked for this service.

steps.title: Determine receipt service.
steps.content: Determine receipt service. Choose whether or not you want to pay for return receipt service, which provides you with a receipt that gives you the certified mail recipient’s signature. [7] X Research source You can choose to obtain this receipt via e-mail, with a PDF image of the signature included, or as a physical receipt via snail mail. As with the restricted delivery service, you need to initial the column on the certified mail form marked for this service.

steps.title: Keep records.
steps.content: Keep records. Collect and keep your receipt that has been stamped with the mailing date. A number that is unique to your mailing allows you to confirm the mail delivery online. Keep all documentation for the mailing in a safe place.

steps.title: View the delivery information.
steps.content: View the delivery information. Check online at the postal service’s Web site to see when and to whom the certified mail was delivered. The recipient must sign for the mail upon delivery, and the post office keeps a record of this signature. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Sign up for a free account.
steps.content: Sign up for a free account. There are several web businesses that offer USPS Certified Mail delivery. You shouldn't have to pay any monthly fees for an account. Look at the price for sending Certified Mail. Decide if the price is worth what you will pay for the service. Make sure that the service offers next-day USPS tracking for your letter. Check to see that the service provides proof of mailing and USPS proof of delivery.

steps.title: Prepare your letter for mailing.
steps.content: Prepare your letter for mailing. Write a letter in your word processing program. Print and sign it if needed. Alternatively, use a form provided by the recipient. Again, print the form and sign it as needed.

steps.title: Scan the document using a scanner.
steps.content: Scan the document using a scanner. Save the scanned document on your hard drive. Make sure that the document is legible and easy to read.

steps.title: Upload your document file onto the website of your mailing service.
steps.content: Upload your document file onto the website of your mailing service. The service will then address, print and mail the letter on the same business day.

steps.title: Keep a copy of your proof of mailing as well as the USPS proof of delivery.
steps.content: Keep a copy of your proof of mailing as well as the USPS proof of delivery.
